httpdocs
Table of Contents

GetCreditNotesPreviewLines

When retrieving a credit note preview, you’ll get a lines property containing the first handful of those items. This URL you can retrieve the full (paginated) list of line items.

HTTP Request

GET \v1\credit_notes\preview\lines{?amount*,credit_amount*,ending_before*,expand*,invoice*,limit*,lines*,memo*,metadata*,out_of_band_amount*,reason*,refund*,refund_amount*,shipping_cost*,starting_after*} HTTP/1.1

host: api.stripe.com:443
eTag: "23423432"
accept: application/json
content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded


{ "example": "Example goes here" }

Parameters

amount [ in: query type: integer ]
The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the total amount of the credit note. optional
credit_amount [ in: query type: integer ]
The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the amount to credit the customer's balance, which will be automatically applied to their next invoice. optional
ending_before [ in: query type: string ]
A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list. optional
expand [ in: query type: array ]
Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded. optional
invoice [ in: query type: string ]
ID of the invoice. required
limit [ in: query type: integer ]
A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10. optional
lines [ in: query type: array ]
Line items that make up the credit note. optional
memo [ in: query type: string ]
The credit note's memo appears on the credit note PDF. optional
metadata [ in: query type: object ]
Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata. optional
out_of_band_amount [ in: query type: integer ]
The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the amount that is credited outside of Stripe. optional
reason [ in: query type: string ]
Reason for issuing this credit note, one of duplicate, fraudulent, order_change, or product_unsatisfactory optional
refund [ in: query type: string ]
ID of an existing refund to link this credit note to. optional
refund_amount [ in: query type: integer ]
The integer amount in cents (or local equivalent) representing the amount to refund. If set, a refund will be created for the charge associated with the invoice. optional
shipping_cost [ in: query type: object ]
When shipping_cost contains the shipping_rate from the invoice, the shipping_cost is included in the credit note. optional
starting_after [ in: query type: string ]
A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list. optional

Request Body Schema

{
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": false
}

Responses

  • 200 Successful response.
  • default Error response.
